required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Extension of a Long-term Safety Study of ALKS 9072 (Also Known as ALKS 9070)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter Extension of Study ALK9072-003EXT to Assess the Long-term Safety and Durability of Effect of ALKS 9072 in Subjects With Stable Schizophrenia

brief_summary.textblock: This is an extension of a previous study (ALK9072-003EXT). The purpose of this study is to continue to evaluate the long-term safety and durability of effect of ALKS 9072 in subjects with stable schizophrenia, and to allow subjects who are doing well on ALKS 9072 to continue treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Subjects With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.description: This measure includes all incidences, including those that occurred >5%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Baseline of Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: This scale consists of symptom constructs (7 positive, 7 negative, 16 general psychopathology), each to be rated on a 7-point Likert-type scale of severity with 1 being absent to 7 being extreme. Minimum scores (best outcome) equals 30 (total scale); maximum scores (worst outcome) equals 210 (total scale). Change is calculated between the baseline visit and the subject's last visit in the treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline to Endpoint in Clinical Global Impression - Severity (CGI-S) Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-S is a 7-point scale that requires the clinician to assess how mentally ill the patient is in a specific point in time. Results indicate participants evaluated at one of the following categories: "1: normal, not at all ill"; "2: borderline mentally ill"; "3: mildly ill"; "4: moderately ill"; "5: markedly ill"; "6: severely ill"; and "7: among the most extremely ill patients". Results indicate a change in CGI-S score from baseline to Day 365 based on the observed data. Change is calculated between the baseline visit and the subject's last visit in the treatment period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completed the treatment period of Study ALK9072-003EXT
- Continues to require chronic treatment with an antipsychotic medication
- Continues to reside in a stable living situation
- Continues to have an identified reliable informant
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abnormal clinical laboratory value, vital sign, or electrocardiogram (ECG) finding during participation in Study ALK9072-003EXT that was clinically relevant and related to study drug
- Missed more than 1 scheduled study visit during participation in the preceding Study ALK9072-003EXT
- Has a significant or unstable medical condition that would preclude safe completion of the current study
- Subject is pregnant or breastfeeding
- Subject expects to be incarcerated, or has pending legal action which may impact compliance with study participation or procedures

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects who successfully completed the treatment period in Study ALK9072-003EXT and continued to meet eligibility criteria were eligible to enroll in this extension study.

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Subjects With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
measure.description: This measure includes all incidences, including those that occurred >5%.
measure.population: Safety population includes all subjects who received at least 1 dose of ALKS 9072 in the current study.

outcome.title: Change in Baseline of Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score Over Time
outcome.description: This scale consists of symptom constructs (7 positive, 7 negative, 16 general psychopathology), each to be rated on a 7-point Likert-type scale of severity with 1 being absent to 7 being extreme. Minimum scores (best outcome) equals 30 (total scale); maximum scores (worst outcome) equals 210 (total scale). Change is calculated between the baseline visit and the subject's last visit in the treatment period.
outcome.population: The full analysis set consisted of all subjects who received at least 1 dose of ALKS 9072 and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of PANSS total score after administration of ALKS 9072.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected at every study visit for up to 35 months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Should an Investigator desire to disclose study results, Sponsor will review the results disclosure prior to public release and can embargo the disclosure for a period of at least 60 days. Revisions to the disclosure will be negotiated in good faith. For a multicenter study the Investigators agree to publish/publicly present the results together with the other sites for the 12 month period after study results are available unless Sponsor grants written permission in advance.
